verses.verse: And Samson <S%H8123><s%> went down <S%H3381><s%> to Timnath <S%H8553><s%>, and saw <S%H7200><s%> a woman <S%H802><s%> in Timnath <S%H8553><s%> of the daughters <S%H1323><s%> of the Philistines <S%H6430><s%>.

And he came up <S%H5927><s%>, and told <S%H5046><s%> his father <S%H1><s%> and his mother <S%H517><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>, I have seen <S%H7200><s%> a woman <S%H802><s%> in Timnath <S%H8553><s%> of the daughters <S%H1323><s%> of the Philistines <S%H6430><s%>: now therefore get <S%H3947><s%> her for me to wife <S%H802><s%>.

Then his father <S%H1><s%> and his mother <S%H517><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H369><s%>, Is there never a woman <S%H802><s%> among the daughters <S%H1323><s%> of your brothers <S%H251><s%>, or among all my people <S%H5971><s%>, that you go <S%H1980><s%> to take <S%H3947><s%> a wife <S%H802><s%> of the uncircumcised <S%H6189><s%> Philistines <S%H6430><s%>? And Samson <S%H8123><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto his father <S%H1><s%>, Get <S%H3947><s%> her for me <S%H3474><s%>; for she pleases me well.

But his father <S%H1><s%> and his mother <S%H517><s%> knew <S%H3045><s%> not that it was of the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, that he sought <S%H1245><s%> an occasion <S%H8385><s%> against the Philistines <S%H6430><s%>: for at that time <S%H6256><s%> the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> had dominion <S%H4910><s%> over Israel <S%H3478><s%>.

Then went <S%H3381><s%> Samson <S%H8123><s%> down <S%H3381><s%>, and his father <S%H1><s%> and his mother <S%H517><s%>, to Timnath <S%H8553><s%>, and came <S%H935><s%> to the vineyards <S%H3754><s%> of Timnath <S%H8553><s%>: and <S%H3715><s%>, behold, a young lion <S%H738><s%> roared <S%H7580><s%> against him <S%H7125><s%>.

And the Spirit <S%H7307><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> came mightily <S%H6743><s%> upon him <S%H8156><s%>, and he tore him as he would have tore <S%H8156><s%> a kid <S%H1423><s%>, and he had nothing <S%H3972><s%> in his hand <S%H3027><s%>: but he told <S%H5046><s%> not his father <S%H1><s%> or his mother <S%H517><s%> what he had done <S%H6213><s%>.
And he went down <S%H3381><s%>, and talked <S%H1696><s%> with the woman <S%H802><s%>; and she pleased <S%H3474><s%> Samson <S%H8123><s%> well <S%H3474><s%>.

And after a time <S%H3117><s%> he returned <S%H7725><s%> to take <S%H3947><s%> her <S%H5493><s%>, and he turned aside to see <S%H7200><s%> the carcass <S%H4658><s%> of the lion <S%H738><s%>: and <S%H5712><s%>, behold, there was a swarm of bees <S%H1682><s%> and honey <S%H1706><s%> in the carcass <S%H1472><s%> of the lion <S%H738><s%>.

And he took <S%H7287><s%> there in his hands <S%H3709><s%>, and went on <S%H3212><s%> eating <S%H398><s%>, and came <S%H1980><s%> to his father <S%H1><s%> and mother <S%H517><s%>, and he gave <S%H5414><s%> them <S%H398><s%>, and they did eat: but he told <S%H5046><s%> not them that he had taken <S%H7287><s%> the honey <S%H1706><s%> out of the carcass <S%H1472><s%> of the lion <S%H738><s%>.

So his father <S%H1><s%> went down <S%H3381><s%> unto the woman <S%H802><s%>: and Samson <S%H8123><s%> made <S%H6213><s%> there a feast <S%H4960><s%>; for so used the young men <S%H970><s%> to do <S%H6213><s%>.
And it came to pass <S%H7200><s%>, when they saw him <S%H3947><s%>, that they brought thirty <S%H7970><s%> companions to be with him <S%H4828><s%>.

And Samson <S%H8123><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto them <S%H2330><s%>, I will now put forth a riddle <S%H2420><s%> unto you <S%H5046><s%>: if you can certainly declare <S%H5046><s%> it me inside the seven <S%H7651><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> of the feast <S%H4960><s%>, and find it out <S%H4672><s%>, then I will give <S%H5414><s%> you thirty <S%H7970><s%> sheets <S%H5466><s%> and thirty <S%H7970><s%> change <S%H2487><s%> of garments <S%H899><s%>:

But if you cannot <S%H3201><s%> declare <S%H5046><s%> it me <S%H5414><s%>, then shall you give me thirty <S%H7970><s%> sheets <S%H5466><s%> and thirty <S%H7970><s%> change <S%H2487><s%> of garments <S%H899><s%>. And they said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H2330><s%>, Put forth your riddle <S%H2420><s%>, that we may hear it <S%H8085><s%>.

And he said <S%H559><s%> unto them <S%H398><s%>, Out of the eater came forth <S%H3318><s%> food <S%H3978><s%>, and out of the strong <S%H5794><s%> came forth <S%H3318><s%> sweetness <S%H4966><s%>. And they could <S%H3201><s%> not in three <S%H7969><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> expound <S%H5046><s%> the riddle <S%H2420><s%>.

And it came to pass on the seventh <S%H7637><s%> day <S%H3117><s%>, that they said <S%H559><s%> unto Samson <S%H8123><s%>'s wife <S%H802><s%>, Entice <S%H6601><s%> your husband <S%H376><s%>, that he may declare <S%H5046><s%> unto us the riddle <S%H2420><s%>, lest we burn <S%H8313><s%> you and your father <S%H1><s%>'s house <S%H1004><s%> with fire <S%H784><s%>: have you called <S%H7121><s%> us to take what we have <S%H3423><s%>? is it not so?

And Samson <S%H8123><s%>'s wife <S%H802><s%> wept <S%H1058><s%> before him <S%H559><s%>, and said, You do but hate <S%H8130><s%> me <S%H157><s%>, and love me not <S%H2330><s%>: you have put forth a riddle <S%H2420><s%> unto the sons <S%H1121><s%> of my people <S%H5971><s%>, and have not told <S%H5046><s%> it me <S%H559><s%>. And he said unto her <S%H5046><s%>, Behold, I have not told it my father <S%H1><s%> nor my mother <S%H517><s%>, and shall I tell it you <S%H5046><s%>

And she wept <S%H1058><s%> before him the seven <S%H7651><s%> days <S%H3117><s%>, while their feast <S%H4960><s%> lasted <S%H1961><s%>: and it came to pass on the seventh <S%H7637><s%> day <S%H3117><s%>, that he told <S%H5046><s%> her <S%H6693><s%>, because she lay severe upon him <S%H5046><s%>: and she told the riddle <S%H2420><s%> to the sons <S%H1121><s%> of her people <S%H5971><s%>.

And the men <S%H582><s%> of the city <S%H5892><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto him on the seventh <S%H7637><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> before the sun <S%H2775><s%> went down <S%H935><s%>, What is sweeter <S%H4966><s%> than honey <S%H1706><s%>? and what is stronger <S%H5794><s%> than a lion <S%H738><s%>? And he said <S%H559><s%> unto them <S%H3884><s%>, If you had not plowed <S%H2790><s%> with my heifer <S%H5697><s%>, you had not found out <S%H4672><s%> my riddle <S%H2420><s%>.

And the Spirit <S%H7307><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> came <S%H6743><s%> upon him <S%H3381><s%>, and he went down to Ashkelon <S%H831><s%>, and killed <S%H5221><s%> thirty <S%H7970><s%> men <S%H376><s%> of them <S%H3947><s%>, and took their plunder <S%H2488><s%>, and gave <S%H5414><s%> change <S%H2487><s%> of garments unto them which expounded <S%H5046><s%> the riddle <S%H2420><s%>. And his anger <S%H639><s%> was kindled <S%H2734><s%>, and he went up <S%H5927><s%> to his father <S%H1><s%>'s house <S%H1004><s%>.
But Samson <S%H8123><s%>'s wife <S%H802><s%> was given to his companion <S%H4828><s%>, whom he had used as his friend <S%H7462><s%>.
